title: Annas
content: 7 by the Roman legate Quirinius and deposed in
) Joseph Caiaphas was high priest, and during this time Annas was a person of great influence in the Sanhedrin. Jesus, when arrested, was first brought to him (
); he also took a leading part in the trial of the Apostles (
). In accordance with Jewish custom he kept the title “high priest” after he was deposed from office.
